DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the time span since the occurrence of neurologic symptoms.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system._An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain._Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than or Equal To Three Months Since Neurologic Symptoms

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To Three Months Since Neurologic Symptoms
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.: Subsequent to; after.: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than Three Months Since Neurologic Symptoms

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than Three Months Since Neurologic Symptoms

A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
